text: I'll be playing Mega Man 11 for sure, but I'm really curious as to why Capcom has not been releasing new games in the MMX series after all this time. I would love for them to alternate between the main series and the X one since they both have their style and strengths.
author: SupraDarky

text: SupraDarky Well.......... The most recent X games haven’t done so well. (X6, X7, X8.) But with the X legacy collection out, at least they still acknowledge the X games. I’d love to see a new one. Also I love Gravity Beetle’s theme. It has a great Megaman 7y vibe to it if that makes sense.

text: I'm pretty sure Capcom straight up said that MM11 sales will determine whether they make MMX9
author: Uncle Al

text: Canonically, X8 is the last in the series. Granted, that’s what X5 was supposed to be until Capcom demanded more... which led to X6 and X7. The less said about them, the better.
author: David E.

text: They made the Zero and ZX series, which were both very much like the X series.  Unfortunately, the ZX games didn't do super well, and that's when they basically killed Mega Man for a while.
author: totlyepic

text: Command Mission came out before X8.

text: I played Megaman X3 on PSX, I love how the SNES sounds in general and I was really hyped to hear the Original Soundtrack of this game on the SNES in that time. Unfortunately I was sadly dissapointed and I prefer by far the CD versions of the Soundtrack. Sincerely I'm happy you put this version.

text: Neat trivia: MMX3's composer, Kinuyo Yamashita, was also the composer for the original Castlevania!
author: drunyon214

text: I can totally see that! All the staccato, the ripping melodies, and the upbeat rock-type music, albeit I'm unfamiliar with the rest of X3's sound track if anyone could point out other great hits from it I would love to dive deeper.
author: Weirdough

text: The Intro Stage from MMX3 is widely acknowledged as the best song in the game (it's definitely the one with the most remixes); it's crazy that it's not on this list yet. IMO, it's one of the 10 best songs on the SNES. Gravity Beetle is also great, as are Crush Crawfish, Doppler Stage 1, and Zero's Theme.
author: drunyon214
